member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.AggregatableAttributeTargetClass
member.summary: Describes the members that are introduced or overridden by the aspect. You can define one or many of these members in classes that are the target of to reacts to events of the Aggregatable pattern.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.AggregatableAttributeTargetClass.OnAncestorChanged(PostSharp.Patterns.Model.AncestorChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Method invoked when an ancestor of the current object has changed. Implement this method only if the target class of implements the interface. For other use cases, subscribe to the event.
member.param: An instance of whose property indicates which object had its modified, or null if this object is the current object.

Options. The default behavior is to enumerate all children, but ignore parent surrogates.
member.returns: false if returned , otherwise true.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.AggregatableClientAttribute.OnInstanceConstructed

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a field or automatic property, specifies that the object assigned to this field or property is a child of the instance of the declaring type.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildAttribute.DisableBehaviorPropagation
member.summary: Determines whether the behaviors applied to the declaring type of the target field should be applied to the object assigned this field. The default value of this property is false, which means that behaviors such as Recordable or threading models will be applied to children (resulting in build- or run-time exception if it is not possible). When it is set to true, behaviors will not be propagated. When applied to a field of collection type, the value applies to collection items.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildAttribute.DisableBuildTimeValidation
member.summary: Determines whether the type of the target field or property should be validated at build-time against the rules of aspects that rely on the Aggregatable model, such as the Recordable aspect or the threading model aspects. If this property is set to true, validation will be performed at runtime only.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildAttribute.IsParentSurrogate
member.summary: Determines whether the value assigned to the field or property is a parent surrogate. The property of children of a parent surrogate are set to the parent of the parent surrogate, instead of to the field itself.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildAttribute.ItemsRelationship
member.summary: Determines the kind of relationship between items

member.param: The object being visited.
Describes the field or other location to which the child is assigned.
member.returns: true to instruct the implementation to continue enumerating other children, false to instruct the implementation to immediately return the false value without enumerating other children.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildVisitorOptions
member.summary: Options for the and methods.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildVisitorOptions.None
member.summary: Enumerates all children, but ignore parent surrogates.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildVisitorOptions.IncludeParentSurrogates
member.summary: Include parent surrogates.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildVisitorOptions.ExcludeIndirectChildren
member.summary: Exclude children of parent surrogates.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DescendantVisitor
member.summary: Encapsulates a method that is invoked by the method.
member.param: The object being visited.
Describes the field or other location to which the child is assigned.
member.returns: A value that determines how the visitor should continue enumerating other objects.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DescendantVisitorStatus
member.summary: Type of the return value of . Determines how the visitor should continue enumerating other objects.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DescendantVisitorStatus.Default
member.summary: Equivalent to for or for .

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DescendantVisitorStatus.Stop
member.summary: Immediately stops enumeration and returns to the caller.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DescendantVisitorStatus.ContinueWithChildren
member.summary: Continues enumerating the children of the current node, then the sibling nodes. This value is not supported by the method.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DescendantVisitorStatus.ContinueWithSiblings
member.summary: Continues enumerating the siblings of the current node, but do not enumerate the children nodes.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.IAttachable
member.summary: Defines setter methods for the .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.IAttachable.AttachToParent(PostSharp.Patterns.Model.RelationshipInfo,PostSharp.Patterns.Model.IAttacher,System.Object)
member.summary: Attaches the current object to a parent object.
member.param: Information about the relationship of the parent node relatively to the current node. The property must be set to or .
A service that allows the current node to attach itself to the parent.
An opaque state object to be passed as the first argument to all methods of the interface.
member.returns: true if the current object was not previously attached to any parent, false if it was already attached to the same parent.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.IAttachable.DetachFromParent
member.summary: Detaches the current object from its parent object.
member.returns: true if the current object has been fully detached, i.e. is no longer attached to its parent by any other relationship, or false if the current object is still attached to the parent by some relationship.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.IAttacher
member.summary: Describes the semantics of a service through which a child object can attach itself to a parent object. This interface is typically implemented by the parent object by composition.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.IAttacher.AttachChild(System.Object,System.Object,PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildInfo)
member.summary: Attach an object as a child of the current node.
member.param: The opaque state object passed to .
The object that must be attached as a child to the current node.

Information about the location (field or collection item, typically) to which the child is assigned and about the relationship of the current node relatively to the parent node. The property must be set to or
member.returns: The new parent of , or null if was already attached to the same parent node through another relationship. If the current node is a parent surrogate, the method returns the parent of the current node.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.IAttacher.DetachChild(System.Object,System.Object,PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildInfo)
member.summary: Detaches an object as a child of the current node.
member.param: The opaque state object passed to .
The object that must be detached as a child as the current node.
member.returns: The former effective parent of , or null if the child is still attached to the parent through another relationship.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.IAttacher.GetNode(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the underlying object instance which is subject to the current attacher. The instance is the aggregatable node that participates in the parent-child relationships with other objects.
member.param: The opaque state object passed to .
member.returns: An object implementing , either directly or dynamically.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.IAttacher.OnChildAttached(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildInfo)
member.summary: Method invoked after a child has been successfully attached to the current node.
member.param: The opaque state object passed to .
The actual parent of . If is assigned to a parent surrogate, the parameter is set to the actual parent, i.e. to the parent of the parent surrogate.
The child object.
Information about the location (field or collection item, typically) to which the child is assigned and about the relationship of the current node relatively to the parent node.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.IAttacher.OnChildDetached(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildInfo)
member.summary: Method invoked when a child has been detached from the current node.

The former actual parent of . If was assigned to a parent surrogate, the parameter is set to the former actual parent, i.e. to the parent of the parent surrogate.
The child object.
Information about the location (field or collection item, typically) to which the child was assigned and about the relationship of the current node relatively to the parent node.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.IDynamicInterfaceImplementation
member.summary: Interface that must be implemented by objects implementing dynamic interfaces, which can be queried using . The interface provides a mean to get a reference back to the principal object.

member.summary: Gets the principal object for which the current object is an indirect interface implementation.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.IQueryInterface
member.summary: Interface implemented by objects that can implement interface dynamically by composition, without implementing the interface directly at MSIL level. The method must then be used instead of a normal cast.

member.summary: Gets the implementation of a specified interface for the current object.

member.returns: An object implementing the interface on behalf of the current object, or null if the current object does not implement the interface.

member.summary: Base class for custom attributes that determine the kind of relationship of objects in a graph.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ObjectAccessLevel

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ObjectAccessLevel.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ObjectAccessLevel.Unknown
member.summary: The required access level is unknown; maximal access is required.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ObjectAccessLevel.Read
member.summary: Read-only.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ObjectAccessLevel.Write
member.summary: Read-write.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ObjectAccessLevel.UpgradeableRead
member.summary: Read-only access that prevents other threads from acquiring or access.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ObjectAccessLevel.Unchecked
member.summary: Disables all runtime verification of access permissions.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ObjectAccessLevel.Yield
member.summary: Indicates that the control flow is passed to another object.

member.summary: Parent (see ).

member.summary: Either or , depending on the type of the specific object assigned to the field or property. This is the default relationship kind for when the property is not set: it causes the field to be a if the object is an or an , otherwise a .

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.AssumeImmutableAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a targetType, means that targetType should be assumed to be immutable. The custom attribute can be applied to an assembly by specifying the property using the constructor.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.AssumeImmutableAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the custom attribute that can be applied to a specific targetType.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.AssumeImmutableAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the custom attribute that can be applied to an assembly, passing the immutable as a constructor argument. This constructor allows to add assumptions for types that are not defined in this current assembly.
member.param: The immutable targetType.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.AssumeImmutableAttribute.TargetType
member.summary: Gets the targetType that should be assumed immutable, if the constructor was used.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ConcurrentAccessToken
member.summary: Token returned by the method. This token is intended to be used in a using block. Consumers of this method must call on success, and on exception.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ConcurrentAccessToken.CheckContext(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether the current is valid in the current context.
member.param: true if the current can be the token of a parent token, false if it must be the token of the current context.
member.returns: true if the current is valid for the current context, otherwise false.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ConcurrentAccessToken.Complete
member.summary: Indicates that the operation requiring access on an object has successfully completed.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ConcurrentAccessToken.Dispose
member.summary: Indicates that the operation requiring access on an object has completed. If the method is not invoked before the method, the transaction is considered to have failed. Current threading models do not support transactions and therefore this semantic is currently unused, but it may be used in the future.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ConcurrentAccessToken.Null
member.summary: Gets a null instance of the type.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IConcurrencyController
member.summary: Controls access to an entity from possibly several threads.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IConcurrencyController.AcquireAccess(PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ObjectAccessLevel,PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ConcurrentAccessToken@)
member.summary: Acquires access on the entity for the current thread.
member.param: The required access level on the entity.
member.returns: An opaque , typically used in a using block. Consumers must invoke the method upon success before exiting the using block.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IConcurrencyController.CheckAccess(PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ObjectAccessLevel)
member.summary: Determines whether the current thread has a specified level of access to the entity.
member.param: The required access level on the entity.
member.returns: true if the current thread has the required level of access, otherwise false.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IConcurrencyController.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Determines whether the entity is currently read-only.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IConcurrencyController.IsSharable
member.summary: Determines whether the entity can currently be accessed concurrently by several threads.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IConcurrencyController.RequireAccess(PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ObjectAccessLevel)
member.summary: Determines whether the current thread has a specified level of access to the entity and throws an exception if not.
member.param: The required access level on the entity.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IConcurrencyController.ThreadingModel
member.summary: Gets the implemented by the current controller.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IThreadAware
member.summary: Interface implemented by objects that are aware of concurrency. Access to thread-aware objects is controlled by a concurrency controller (). Any aspect implementing a threading model (ThreadAwareObjectAttribute) introduces this interface to the target class and ensures that accesses to this class go through the controller.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IThreadAware.ConcurrencyController
member.summary: Gets the concurrency controller for the current object.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IThreadAware.OnParentControllerChanged(PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IConcurrencyController)
member.summary: Notifies the object that the effective controller of it's parent has changed. The new parent controller or null.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAwareExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods to the interface.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAwareExtensions.AcquireAccess(PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IThreadAware,PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ObjectAccessLevel,PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ConcurrentAccessToken@)
member.summary: Acquires access for a given object.
member.param: The instance for which access is required.
The level of access required.
At output, a that should be disposed when access is no longer required.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingException
member.summary: Base class for exceptions thrown by the PostSharp.Patterns.Threading component.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingModel
member.summary: Base class for all threading models. Defines properties that describe the characteristics of threading models. All classes derived from are necessarily singletons.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingModel.IsThreadSafe
member.summary: Determines whether the threading model is possibly thread safe.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingModel.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current object.
member.returns: A string that represents the current object.

member.summary: Enumerates the aspect roles (for use with ) used by the PostSharp.Patterns.Threading component.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingPatternsAspectRoles.ThreadingModel
member.summary: Role of an aspect that provides a threading model.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Utilities.LocalizedTextProvider

Arguments.

member.summary: Gets a message declared by the or the rest of responsibility chain if applicable.
